result.execSummary:
The defendant Tomas L Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay costs.  *Payment Plan for all costs:  $50/month, commencing in October, 2015.

*Huber granted.  *May be served in Waushara County.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence he may be serving

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tomas L Sanchez in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to Waushara County and any other sentence 
(defendant is currently in Waushara County Jail)
May serve in Waushara County 
Credit = 3 days
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in October

Pre-trial conference at 07-14-2015 10:45 am.
Return date at 08-20-2015 02:30 pm.

with conditions:
*No contact with Danielle Schuster or her residence throughout the pendency of the case
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Defendant Tomas L Sanchez in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states charges.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant has no questions regarding his rights.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a probation hold.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with Danielle Schuster or her residence throughout the pendency of the case
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

   BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant has some questions for the court.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts the defendant's waiver of Attorney.   Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return / Pre-Trial with the DA.

  Return date scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 10:45 am.
